title: Clutch Cable - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
Make sure the grommet and two retaining clips are fitted to the clutch cable.
Feed the clutch cable through the upper yoke and position the clutch cable as noted during removal.
Feed the clutch cable through the radiator lower bracket.
Attach the inner cable to the clutch lever and actuating arm using a reversal of the removal process.
Install the outer cable into the adjuster bracket at the clutch end.
Attach the clutch cable retaining clip to the right hand headstock gusset.
Install the clutch cable retaining clip onto the right upper fairing bracket.
Secure the grommet to the lower radiator bracket.
Make sure that the two adjuster nuts are positioned one either side of the bracket.
Make sure the steering is at full right lock to adjust the clutch cable.
Turn the steering to full right lock.
Set the lever adjuster to a position where an equal adjustment is possible in both directions.
Set the adjuster at the clutch end to give a preliminary setting of 2 - 3 mm of free play as measured at the lever. Tighten the lock nut.
Operate the clutch lever several times and recheck the amount of free play.
Set the final adjustment of the cable to give 2 - 3 mm of free play at the lever by turning the adjuster nut and lock nut at the lever end.
